title: Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate, 4-23-09 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




April 23, 2009

 



Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate, 4-23-09




 THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary   For Immediate Release  April 23, 2009 NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE:  Victor M. Mendez, of Arizona, to be Administrator of the Federal Highway Administration, vice Thomas J. Madison, resigned. Stephen Alan Owens, of Arizona, to be Assistant Administrator for Toxic Substances of the Environmental Protection Agency, vice James B. Gulliford, resigned. Rajiv J. Shah, of Washington, to be Under Secretary of Agriculture for Research, Education, and Economics, vice Gale A. Buchanan, resigned.
